result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam L. White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Handgun-Alcohol Sold/Consumed, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.237(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment, schooling, or a combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, and if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior authorization.
No possession of dangerous weapons.
No contact with B.T. unless authorized by agent.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
SAFE program.
Firearms not used in this incident should be returned to defendant's Father.
NO days jail credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

and Reimbursement to County - signed 7/31/15
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:15 am 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty Dan Cveykus.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Battery/Use of Dangerous Weapon/DA)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Carry Handgun-Alcohol Sold)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct. 4 (DC/Use of Dangerous Weapon)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Cveykus makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 18 months probation - CONDITIONS: SAFE program; AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours of CS per week; no possession of dangerous weapons; no contact with B.T. unless authorized by agent; court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit. 
COURT notes firearms not used in this incident should be returned to def's father. 

Adj: 8:28 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
